intro: Hibbertia billardierei var. monadelpha, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense, globular inflorescences. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a waxy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Hibbertia billardierei var. monadelpha is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its ornamental value.
